question: [File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/mod.rs] [Function: Cmd::run()] [Access Control] Does the run() method validate that only authorized operators can execute database inspection commands, or can any user with binary access read sensitive blockchain state including transaction data, validator information, and pruner progress? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/mod.rs] [Function: Cmd::run()] [Information Disclosure] Can the command dispatcher be exploited to leak sensitive database metadata through error messages when match arms fail, potentially revealing internal database structure to unauthorized parties? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/mod.rs] [Struct: Cmd enum] [Command Injection] Can malicious subcommand variants be injected or crafted to bypass intended debugging operations and execute arbitrary database queries beyond PrintDbVersions and PrintRawDataByVersion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/mod.rs] [Function: Cmd::run()] [Error Handling] Does the error propagation from subcommand run() methods properly sanitize sensitive database information before returning Results, or could stack traces expose internal database paths and schema details? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_db_versions.rs] [Function: Cmd::run()] [Path Traversal] Can an attacker supply a maliciously crafted db_dir path containing '../' sequences to access database files outside the intended directory, potentially reading sensitive validator keys or configuration files stored elsewhere? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_db_versions.rs] [Function: Cmd::run()] [Information Disclosure] Does the function expose sensitive ledger commit progress, state merkle versions, and pruner status that could reveal transaction timing information useful for front-running attacks or validator behavior analysis? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_db_versions.rs] [Function: Cmd::run() lines 46-53] [Database Lock Bypass] Can AptosDB::open_dbs() in readonly mode be called while the database is actively being written by a validator node, potentially causing read inconsistencies or exposing partially committed state that violates consensus safety? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_db_versions.rs] [Function: Cmd::run() line 41] [Configuration Manipulation] Can the sharding_config.enable_storage_sharding parameter be maliciously toggled to access sharded databases with incorrect configuration, causing shard index confusion and reading state from wrong validator shards? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_db_versions.rs] [Function: Cmd::run() lines 56-58] [Metadata Disclosure] Does get_synced_version() expose the exact synchronization state that could be used to determine if a validator is behind, making it a target for eclipse attacks or consensus manipulation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_db_versions.rs] [Function: Cmd::run() lines 60-73] [State Inconsistency Detection] Can discrepancies between Ledger Progress, StateKv Progress, and StateMerkle Progress be exploited to identify validators with corrupted state, enabling targeted attacks on validators with inconsistent databases? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_db_versions.rs] [Function: Cmd::run() lines 75-126] [Pruner Progress Manipulation] Does exposing all pruner progress states (Event, Transaction, TransactionInfo, WriteSet, etc.) allow attackers to determine which historical data has been deleted, enabling them to exploit the lack of historical proof for old transactions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_db_versions.rs] [Function: Cmd::run() lines 80-86] [Schema Access] Can the DbMetadataKey::EventPrunerProgress query be manipulated through schema key injection to access unauthorized metadata keys or trigger database corruption through malformed key access? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_db_versions.rs] [Function: Cmd::run() lines 136-144] [Shard Enumeration] Does the loop iterating through NUM_STATE_SHARDS expose the exact sharding configuration, allowing attackers to map which account states are stored in which shards for targeted state corruption attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_db_versions.rs] [Function: Cmd::run() lines 154-184] [Epoch Ending State Leak] Can the EpochEndingStateMerkle pruner progress information be used to determine epoch boundaries and validator set change timing, enabling attackers to time attacks during epoch transitions when consensus may be vulnerable? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_db_versions.rs] [Function: Cmd::run() lines 187-189] [Ledger Info Disclosure] Does get_latest_ledger_info_option() expose complete validator signatures, voting power distribution, and quorum certificate details that could be analyzed to identify Byzantine validators or consensus weaknesses? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_db_versions.rs] [Function: Cmd::run() lines 191-194] [JMT Version Exposure] Can get_current_version_in_state_merkle_db() be exploited to determine the exact Jellyfish Merkle Tree node versions, enabling attackers to reconstruct the tree structure and identify accounts with high-value state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_db_versions.rs] [Function: Cmd::run() lines 196-218] [Version Mismatch Detection] Can discrepancies between TransactionInfo, Transaction, VersionData, and WriteSet max versions indicate database corruption that could be exploited to cause state divergence between validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_db_versions.rs] [Function: Cmd::run() lines 220-231] [Accumulator Size Leak] Does exposing the number of frozen nodes in TransactionAccumulator reveal the exact transaction count, which could be used to analyze transaction patterns or identify high-value transaction batches? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_db_versions.rs] [Function: Cmd::run() lines 233-243] [Metadata Enumeration] Can print_metadata_items() expose all database metadata including internal configuration, feature flags, or validator-specific settings that should remain confidential? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_db_versions.rs] [Function: Cmd::run() lines 245-255] [Epoch History Exposure] Does printing the last 10 epoch endings reveal validator rotation patterns, staking changes, or governance actions that could be used to predict future validator behavior or consensus decisions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_db_versions.rs] [Function: get_latest_version_for_schema() lines 260-267] [Iterator Misuse] Can the iter.seek_to_last() call on database iterators cause performance degradation or resource exhaustion if executed repeatedly on very large databases, enabling DoS against validator nodes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_db_versions.rs] [Function: get_latest_version_for_schema()] [Type Confusion] Does the generic Schema<Key = Version> constraint properly validate that only version-keyed schemas are queried, or can type confusion lead to accessing schemas with different key types causing panics or incorrect version reads? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_db_versions.rs] [Function: print_metadata_items() lines 269-276] [Unbounded Iteration] Can print_metadata_items() be exploited with databases containing millions of metadata entries to cause memory exhaustion or indefinite execution, effectively DoSing the debugging tool and validator node? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_db_versions.rs] [Function: print_metadata_items()] [Schema Deserialization] Does the iteration over DbMetadataSchema properly handle malformed or corrupted metadata entries, or could invalid serialized data cause panics or expose deserialization vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_db_versions.rs] [Struct: Cmd lines 28-36] [Input Validation] Does the db_dir PathBuf parameter validate that the path exists, is readable, and points to a valid AptosDB instance, or can invalid paths cause panics or unexpected behavior? (Medium)
